result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney J Scalzo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by Friday, October 17, 2014 at 3:00 PM.

08/28/15 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION ON BOTH COUNTS FOR ONE YEAR TO 10/15/16.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no unsupervised contact with any juvenile males unless they are family members.
Must have no contact with M.S.

Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence and if defendant is not required to register as a sex offender.

08/28/15 AMENDED: COURT FINDS THE DEFENDANT IS NO LONGER ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNCTION.

Must participate in and complete a sex offender psycho-sexual evaluation.
Requirement to register as a sex offender will be held open pending the evaluation.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
10/27/14 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS DNA TO BE COLLECTED.
09/13/16 AMENDED:  COURT DOES NOT ORDER SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 4/6/15:  COURT ORDERS 60 DAYS JAIL AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney J Scalzo

of conviction.

Defendant Courtney J Scalzo in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Criminal Complaint previously filed on 10/9/14. Defense relates. 
Defendant pleads guilty to both counts. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. 

Court relates and orders: 

Counts 1 & 2: 
SW
1 year probation. Must report by Friday, October 17, 2014 at 3:00 PM. 
Must participate and complete a sex offender psycho-sexual evaluation. 
Requirement to register as a sex offender will be held open pending the evaluation. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
Must not have unsupervised contact with any juvenile males unless they are family members.
Must not have contact with M.S. 
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence and not be registered as a sex offender. 
Costs
  Review hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

State requests prelim be held over with cause and plea/sentencing hearing scheduled.  Court finds good cause to continue preliminary hearing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
